title: Chromatic Number
content:
**chromaticNumber:**

The minimum number of colors needed to properly color a graph G, where adjacent vertices receive different colors.

For infinite graphs, this is a cardinal number, not just a natural number.
mathContext: Cardinal-valued chromatic numbers are essential for infinite graph theory.

title: Cycle Structure

**Cycle V G n:**

A cycle of length n is a closed walk with n distinct vertices (except start = end) where consecutive vertices are adjacent.

title: Odd Cycle
content:
**isOddCycle:**

A cycle is odd if its length n is odd (3, 5, 7, ...).

Odd cycles are special: a graph is bipartite iff it has no odd cycles. The smallest odd cycle is a triangle (n = 3).

content:
**isTriangleFree:**

Triangle-free graphs are a fundamental class studied extensively in extremal graph theory.

title: Induced Subgraph
content:
**inducedSubgraph:**

Given a subset S of vertices, the induced subgraph on S keeps exactly the edges of G that have both endpoints in S.

This is the natural way to restrict a graph to a subset.

title: Girth

**girth:**

Graphs with high girth are sparse and have strong structural properties.
